page.title: 01 INTRODUCTION
page.content: Two thirds of this area is in the Sandwell district of Walsall, while the remaining third consists of parts of the Great Barr and Kingstanding areas of Birmingham to the south west of Sutton Park. The residential areas of Walsall merge with those in Birmingham, having been developed steadily during the last sixty years. The four most northerly squares, located in Walsall, are mainly farmland- mostly rough grazing and cultivated grassland with some arable land. Bordering on the farmland are extensive hospital grounds, a golf course and several sports grounds which are in use most weekends.The south westerly section of the area includes Junction 7 of the M6 which connects with other routes. In the south east lies a small but concentrated light industrial area.
